## Description {#details}

Generic implementation of equivalence classes through the use Tarjan&#39;s efficient union-find algorithm.

<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// EquivalenceClasses - This represents a collection of equivalence classes and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// supports three efficient operations: insert an element into a class of its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// own, union two classes, and find the class for a given element.  In</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// addition to these modification methods, it is possible to iterate over all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of the equivalence classes and all of the elements in a class.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This implementation is an efficient implementation that only stores one copy</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of the element being indexed per entry in the set, and allows any arbitrary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// type to be indexed (as long as it can be ordered with operator&lt; or a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// comparator is provided).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Here is a simple example using integers:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  EquivalenceClasses&lt;int&gt; EC;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  EC.unionSets(1, 2);                // insert 1, 2 into the same set</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  EC.insert(4); EC.insert(5);        // insert 4, 5 into own sets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  EC.unionSets(5, 1);                // merge the set for 1 with 5&#39;s set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  for (EquivalenceClasses&lt;int&gt;::iterator I = EC.begin(), E = EC.end();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       I != E; ++I) &#123;           // Iterate over all of the equivalence sets.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    if (!I-&gt;isLeader()) continue;   // Ignore non-leader sets.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    for (EquivalenceClasses&lt;int&gt;::member&#95;iterator MI = EC.member&#95;begin(I);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///         MI != EC.member&#95;end(); ++MI)   // Loop over members in this set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///      cerr &lt;&lt; &#42;MI &lt;&lt; &quot; &quot;;  // Print member.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    cerr &lt;&lt; &quot;\\n&quot;;   // Finish set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This example prints:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   5 1 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ElemTy, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Compare = std::less&lt;ElemTy&gt;&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a9dc0b27026bcd7953eada1a9f3c6d1c8">EquivalenceClasses</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ECValue - The EquivalenceClasses data structure is just a set of these.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Each of these represents a relation for a value.  First it stores the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value itself, which provides the ordering that the set queries.  Next, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// provides a &quot;next pointer&quot;, which is used to enumerate all of the elements</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// in the unioned set.  Finally, it defines either a &quot;end of list pointer&quot; or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &quot;leader pointer&quot; depending on whether the value itself is a leader.  A</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &quot;leader pointer&quot; points to the node that is the leader for this element,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if the node is not a leader.  A &quot;end of list pointer&quot; points to the last</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// node in the list of members of this list.  Whether or not a node is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// leader is determined by a bit stolen from one of the pointers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">ECValue &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// findLeader - Given a value in the set, return a member iterator for the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// union - Merge the two equivalence sets for the specified values, inserting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// them if they do not already exist in the equivalence set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a9f74b404e98ecd2608f87f7d561771e2"><span class="doxyHighlight">  member&#95;iterator <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a9f74b404e98ecd2608f87f7d561771e2">unionSets</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ElemTy &amp;V1, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ElemTy &amp;V2) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a0f6658f41713c51e16cb0eb989242c8f">iterator</a> V1I = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a3374117a1d6fa56b240853fb8da871b1">insert</a>(V1), V2I = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a3374117a1d6fa56b240853fb8da871b1">insert</a>(V2);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#abf907bded6ddfb5a9bc7431f159b0046"><span class="doxyHighlight">  member&#95;iterator <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#abf907bded6ddfb5a9bc7431f159b0046">unionSets</a>(member&#95;iterator L1, member&#95;iterator L2) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(L1 != <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a355ac386262a099693abd5b51c60e137">member&#95;end</a>() &amp;&amp; L2 != <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/equivalenceclasses/#a355ac386262a099693abd5b51c60e137">member&#95;end</a>() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Illegal inputs!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (L1 == L2) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> L1;   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Unifying the same two sets, noop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, this is a real union operation.  Set the end of the L1 list to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// point to the L2 leader node.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ECValue &amp;L1LV = &#42;L1.Node, &amp;L2LV = &#42;L2.Node;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">    L1LV.getEndOfList()-&gt;setNext(&amp;L2LV);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Update L1LV&#39;s end of list pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlight">    L1LV.Leader = L2LV.getEndOfList();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Clear L2&#39;s leader flag:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">    L2LV.Next = L2LV.getNext();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// L2&#39;s leader is now L1.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlight">    L2LV.Leader = &amp;L1LV;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> L1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// isEquivalent - Return true if V1 is equivalent to V2. This can happen if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// V1 is equal to V2 or if they belong to one equivalence class.</span></CodeLine>
